attributes.action: put back the £5 billion a year removed in 1997 into the private pension system and consult with the finance industry on the best way of doing this in order to help restore confidence in the pension system.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: One of the first stealth taxes introduced in Gordon Brown’s 1997 budget was to stop the tax break that allowed pension schemes to claim a tax credit on the dividend payments for shares owned by pension schemes. Experts estimate this has taken £5 billion a year out of the pension system and has contributed to the decline in pension funding and resulted in reduced investment returns. We call on the government to put back this £5 billion a year into the private pension system and consult with the finance industry on the best way of doing this in order to help restore confidence in the pension system.
